scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. Previously, when one of the team members, Alex, said, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time,' you responded by encouraging the team to stay focused and work together. During a team meeting, [Monica] slammed her pen on the table and added, 'Even if we try our best, there's no way we can meet this deadline.' [Bob] nodded in agreement, looking equally concerned. You suggested taking a pause to rethink the approach. Now, with the team gathered again, [Monica] leaned back in her chair, crossing her arms, and said, 'So, what’s the new grand plan?' You responded by suggesting to reassess the resources and see if additional support can be obtained. Now, [Bob] rubbed his temples and muttered, 'I just can't see how this will work. We're setting ourselves up for failure.' [Monica] exhaled deeply, clearly frustrated. You motivated the team by recalling past successes and encouraging them to focus on what they can control.
scenes.description: Bob's frustration is growing, and Monica's irritation is palpable. You need to find a way to address their concerns while keeping the team motivated.

options.text: Let's take it one step at a time. We'll reassess the resources and break down the tasks further.
options.analysis: You acknowledged the growing frustration and suggested a step-by-step approach, showing good emotional perception and empathy.

options.text: I get that this looks challenging. Maybe we should consider bringing in temporary help for this project.
options.analysis: You recognized the challenge and proposed a practical solution to get additional help, demonstrating good self-regulation and social skills.

options.text: We’ve managed tight deadlines before, and we can do it again. Let’s focus on what we can control.
options.analysis: You focused on motivating the team by recalling past successes, demonstrating high motivation but lower empathy and emotional perception.
